definition: to fix/to settle/a libation to the dead

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Wang Guowei is the founder of China's modern aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 王国维是中国现代美学的奠基者。

sentences.english: They believed the nation was a "new order for the ages."
sentences.chinese: 因为奠基者们认为，这个国家是“旧时代的新秩序”。

sentences.english: The farmers are the founders of civilization and prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 农民是文化和繁荣的奠基者。

sentences.english: It takes a certain class of founder to attract top notch talent.
sentences.chinese: 这需要一定阶段的奠基者来吸引顶级人才。

sentences.english: Guo Moruo is a well-deserved founder of Chinese New Poetry.
sentences.chinese: 郭沫若当之无愧是中国新诗的奠基者。

sentences.english: Mr. Chen Heqin is the founder of Chinese preschool education.
sentences.chinese: 陈鹤琴先生是中国现代学前教育的奠基者。

sentences.english: Professor Yin Junsheng is the founder and pioneer of the International Reportage.
sentences.chinese: 尹均生教授是国际报告文学学科的奠基者和开创者。

sentences.english: In 1935 one of the founders of modern genetics, J.
sentences.chinese: 早在1935年，现代遗传学的奠基者之一，J。

sentences.english: Reason and spirit are two important dimensions of idealism advanced by the Cheng brothers.
sentences.chinese: 理与气是理学奠基者二程理学本体论的重要范畴。

definition: representative individual (of a school of thought)
the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)
